node.title: Whiskey Town Lake Fishing Report: March 2020
node.excerpt: We have started our spring Kokanee season at Whiskey Town Lake and the fishing has been fair to good. The quality and size of this years fish are great! This is a great sign for the summer and I wouldn’t hesitate to come fish now. Chartreuse Paulina Peak Micro Shrimp and Pink Micro Hoochies are… Read More »
node.content:
We have started our spring Kokanee season at Whiskey Town Lake and the fishing has been fair to good.

The quality and size of this years fish are great! This is a great sign for the summer and I wouldn’t hesitate to come fish now.

Chartreuse Paulina Peak Micro Shrimp and Pink Micro Hoochies are the best right now.

Fish are all over the depth column. As summer approaches these fish will concentrate at a constant depth and will be an easy target.

Now is a good time to fish and action will continue for the months to come. Let’s go!

node.altText: Whiskey Town Lake Kokanee - The Trinity Guide

node.title: Trinity River Fishing Report: January 2020
node.excerpt: More steelhead moving upstream into the upper Trinity River Trinity river has been fishing fair to good with new groups of fish pushing up with every inch of rainfall fall. January through February is looking good for productive fishing on the Trinity River. Remember some days are better than others. The best fishing happens for those… Read More »
node.content:
More steelhead moving upstream into the upper Trinity River

Trinity river has been fishing fair to good with new groups of fish pushing up with every inch of rainfall fall. January through February is looking good for productive fishing on the Trinity River.

Remember some days are better than others. The best fishing happens for those who go. Timing is everything some days you hit it perfectly other days you are just in between the runs.

node.title: Trinity River Fishing Report: March 2020
node.excerpt: With little rain this season, the trinity river is low and clear. But don’t be discouraged! The steelhead fishing is very productive with numbers ranging from 1-10 fish per day. Fishing has been good, the next month is looking good. The low & clear water conditions tend to favor fly fishing tactics. Bait tactics have… Read More »
node.content:
With little rain this season, the trinity river is low and clear. But don’t be discouraged!

The steelhead fishing is very productive with numbers ranging from 1-10 fish per day. Fishing has been good, the next month is looking good.

The low & clear water conditions tend to favor fly fishing tactics. Bait tactics have been tough.

Top flies have been pheasant tails and black rubber legs.

Did you know we have started out spring campaign over at Whiskey Town Lake? Read about the amazing fishing on Whiskey Town Lake here.

node.altText: Trinity River Steelhead - The Trinity Guide

node.title: Trinity River Fishing Report: November 11, 2019
node.excerpt: With low water and no rain The Trinity River is slow. Rain really allows steelhead to move up the system and get over nets on the lower river that mitigate healthy runs of fish through the entire watershed. All said, better days ahead once we get a good gushing of water. Expect to work hard… Read More »
node.content:
With low water and no rain The Trinity River is slow. Rain really allows steelhead to move up the system and get over nets on the lower river that mitigate healthy runs of fish through the entire watershed. All said, better days ahead once we get a good gushing of water.

Expect to work hard for your fish and going home empty handed is par for the course.

Better reports will come in. This is a great time to be on the Trinity and honestly if you don’t come, then the great reports will never be produced.

Hot lures are pegged beads and bait.

The hot fly seems to be a classic trinity jimmy leg. I have been mostly fishing the Lower Sac in Redding were the bite has been hot! Fish the Lower Sacramento if you must get into fish.

As soon as you see rain, be here the next day.

node.title: Trinity River Fishing Report: December 2019
node.excerpt: The fishing has been good on the Trinity River! The rain has arrived on the Trinity River in N. California! With more water coming down the river things are looking good.  Steelhead have moved upriver into the Junction City, Douglas City and Lewiston areas of the Trinity River. 1-5 steelhead a day has been what we… Read More »
node.content:
The fishing has been good on the Trinity River!

The rain has arrived on the Trinity River in N. California! With more water coming down the river things are looking good.  Steelhead have moved upriver into the Junction City, Douglas City and Lewiston areas of the Trinity River.

1-5 steelhead a day has been what we have been experiencing witch is a major improvement from the past month of slow fishing where we weren’t finding any fish.

With rain, not only do the steelhead show up, but so do anglers! We won’t have the river to ourselves, but it’s not exactly bumper boats out there on the water either.

We are finding pockets of fish were others are not. Bait and pegged beads have been hot as well as stone flys and my ever faithful birds nest.

Expect to share the river with friends

Let’s not forget that all though things have picked up its almost impossible to predict what day will be the best day to find steelhead. Conditions change a little every-single day and steelhead are not residing in any given section. Steelhead move upstream every day conditions allow.

Book a date and come fishing for Steelhead on the Trinity River! This is really the best way to find the fish of your dreams!

node.title: Trinity River Fishing Report: Late September 2019
node.excerpt: All though we are having a great salmon run this year over all, the fish enter the river in waves causing strong weeks of fishing and slow weeks. We have seen the last of our summer run salmon for the year and are now waiting on our fall fish to arrive. With large numbers of… Read More »
node.content:
All though we are having a great salmon run this year over all, the fish enter the river in waves causing strong weeks of fishing and slow weeks.

We have seen the last of our summer run salmon for the year and are now waiting on our fall fish to arrive. With large numbers of fish in the Klamath River we are soon to see them heading our way.

I have been sticking to the basics. Back bouncing roe and bobber fishing have been my go to tactics for putting kings in the net.

Steelhead are on their way!

We are just starting to see the spear head of the autumn run. I expect great times ahead. The Trinity River never disappoints starting today and going all the way through March of 2020.

Stay tuned for more detail in future reports on the Trinity. September is sort of a time of transition on this river. If getting into steelhead wearing shorts and sandals sound appealing, fish the Trinity in September.

Book for next year right now:

node.title: Trinity River Fishing Report: September 2019
node.excerpt: Summer run fish are now turning in to fall run fish and the bite is on! Regular limits are being caught with some days better than others of course (that’s fishing). The fishing has been red hot. I have been sticking to basics back bouncing fresh red roe in my favorite holes and scoring some good fish.… Read More »
node.content:
Summer run fish are now turning in to fall run fish and the bite is on!

Regular limits are being caught with some days better than others of course (that’s fishing).

The fishing has been red hot.

I have been sticking to basics back bouncing fresh red roe in my favorite holes and scoring some good fish. All though this method of fishing can be tuff on new Fishermen it works! For the people who struggle to get the hang of it bobbers have also been working really well. The fish have had some dark red meat and lots of fat perfect for the bbq or the smoker. With fall closing in we can expect some fresh chrome salmon moving in to the river and the time is now to fill your freezer!

node.title: Whiskey Town Lake Fishing Report: September 2019
node.excerpt: The bite is still wide open with early limits daily! We have been back to the dock as others are launching their boat all summer. There is a window of time to catch these fish and it is closing as they prepare to move up the creeks and spawn. This summer has produced some jumbo… Read More »
node.content:
The bite is still wide open with early limits daily!

We have been back to the dock as others are launching their boat all summer.

There is a window of time to catch these fish and it is closing as they prepare to move up the creeks and spawn.

This summer has produced some jumbo kokanee up to 20 inches and plenty of line pealing action!

The hot colors have been pink and orange all summer running paulina peak and Vance takle have been unstoppable!

Remembering always to keep a slow trolling speed (under 1.7) will keep fish biting all day. Consider getting in on the Kokanee action soon! With in a couple of weeks these fish will start turning red and will no longer be table fair.

All though we have not seen that yet we are anticipating a change soon.

node.title: Whiskey Town Lake Fishing Report: August 2019
node.excerpt: Whiskey town has been on fire. This lake has been kicking out limits daily. I keep expecting a change and I’m sure its coming but it has not happened yet. I think this is quite possibly the best year I have seen on Whiskey Town Lake. As we approach the end of summer we can… Read More »
node.content:
Whiskey town has been on fire. This lake has been kicking out limits daily.

I keep expecting a change and I’m sure its coming but it has not happened yet.

I think this is quite possibly the best year I have seen on Whiskey Town Lake.

As we approach the end of summer we can expect to see a physical change in the fish as they prepare to make their way up the creeks to spawn. That being said their size and aggression will increase. And we should have continued, quality fishing for the next 2 months on Whiskey Town Lake.

Hot Lures:

  • Vance Dodgers with orange or pink.
  • Mack’s or Vance hoochies with 8-9 inch leaders.
  • Wonder bread patterns from Paulina Peak paired with their Pro Series Dodgers have been keeping the fish on the bite.

Pro Tip:

If your running 4 downriggers or stacking run the Vance Dodgers above the Pualina Peak, Pro series Dodgers from Paulina Peak are heavy and will tangle with your other gear. Trolling speed has been 1.4-1.6 and my depth has been 38-50 all summer.

Like so meany days a few guys catch most of the fish while the others struggle. Take note of the details when Kokanee fishing. Use what you are confident in and keep your lines in the water. Avoid tangles or unnecessary time out of the water. To maximize your time fishing always fish as many lines as you can handle. Don’t be afraid to stack your downriggers or use multiple. The wider your spread, the more water you cover, the more fish you will catch. Good luck out there guys see you at whiskey town lake!

Want to get in touch? Contact me here:

node.title: Lake Shasta Fishing Report For July 20th, 2019
node.excerpt: Lake Shasta has had a slow start this year but is now showing a consistent bite as of late July. Most fish coming between 45-60 feet of water. Working the edges of the main body and using your fish finder to mark schooling shad is paying off with larg rainbows coming over the rail. Fishing… Read More »
node.content:
Lake Shasta has had a slow start this year but is now showing a consistent bite as of late July.

Most fish coming between 45-60 feet of water.

Working the edges of the main body and using your fish finder to mark schooling shad is paying off with larg rainbows coming over the rail.

Fishing shad patterns and large spoons such as the popeye from trinadad takle is the way to go.

I think the lake will fish steady for the next 2 months and I’m still booking!

Contact me by phone of fill out my form below and I’ll get right back to you within a day if not minutes.
